parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To forget entirely, make to forget. Middle voice from ek and lanthano; to be utterly oblivious of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To converse, address, preach, lecture; I argue, reason. Middle voice from dia and lego; to say thoroughly, i.e. Discuss.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From a compound of oligos and ora; to have little regard for, i.e. To disesteem.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
From paideuo; tutorage, i.e. Education or training; by implication, disciplinary correction.
And not, not even, neither?nor. From me and de; but not, not even; in a continued negation, nor.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To loose, release, unloose (as a bow-string), relax, enfeeble; pass: To be faint, grow weary. From ek and luo; to relax.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I reprove, rebuke, discipline, (b) I expose, show to be guilty. Of uncertain affinity; to confute, admonish.
